derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (in sense 3): apparently a variant of mash
mid 19th cent.: probably an alteration of French marchez! or marchons!, imperatives of marcher 'to advance'

entry.tran: 烂糊状东西;软乎乎的东西
entry.def: Mush is a thick, soft paste.

example.ex: The brown mush in the fridge is some veg soup left over.
example.tran: 冰箱里的棕色糊状东西是一些剩的蔬菜汤。

entry.tran: 感伤的事物;多愁善感的作品
entry.def: If you describe something such as a film or book as mush, you mean that it is very sentimental.

example.ex: Whenever famous actresses get together to make a 'woman's film' you can bet on an overload of sentimental mush.
example.tran: 无论什么时候，只要知名女演员们聚在一起，去演绎一部“女性题材电影”，那毫无疑问里面准是一堆多愁善感的故事。

entry.def: If you mush something, you make it into a  mush.

means.word_mean: 3. an expression that is excessively sweet and sentimental
1. drive (a team of dogs or a dogsled)

sentences.en: I have never read such a load of mush!
